page.title: 01BERNERA:Tobson.
page.content: This area contains the smaller islands to the north of the island of Great Bernera and the northern end of Great Bernera. The largest of these small islands Little Bernera, measures 1 sq.km. and is uninhabited. The islands of Kealasay, Floday, Bearasay and Campay are low lying and grass covered. There are many other rocky islets. The northern end of the island of Great Bernera is rough heathery hilly moorland. The small crofting township of Bosta on the northern coast has a secluded beach near the cemetary.
